content: and is worked like this bring the yarn forward slip the next stitch purlwise take the yarn back again replace the slipped stitch on the left hand needle bring the yarn forward again and turn the work because of all the turning it s best to knit the hats on short � needles 2 to begin … using the long tail method cast on 10 stitches leaving enough of a tail to sew a short seam ridge 1 k2 w&t k2 ridge 2 k4 w&t k4 ridge 3 k6 w&t k6 ridge 4 k8 w&t k8 ridge 5 k6 w&t k6 ridge 6 k4 w&t k4 that s one pie-shaped section done now repeat these six ridges until you have a semi-circle or nearly a semi- circle i ve worked five repeats here but you may decide to knit a different number depending on your yarn and gauge knit one ridge on all ten stitches this is to knit those first two stitches which would otherwise just sit at the end of the needle getting stretched now continue repeating the six ridges until you have knitted a circle it s unlikely to be a perfect circle stop when the circle is nearly complete rather than when it s more than a circle i worked another four repeats giving me nine in all don t worry about that gap knitting stretches knit one row and then cast off nine stitches leaving you with one stitch at the outside of the circle 3 joining ridges next you will start working joining ridges round the edge of the circle you ll use joins and short row both of which are explained on page 2 whenever it says join do this slip one stitch knitwise pick up and knit one stitch from the edge pass slipped stitch over turn and knit one stitch when working joining ridges i tend to pick up the stitch from the bottom of the bump just in from the edge but there are no hard and fast rules about this watch out for those tiny two stitch ridges the first joining ridge will be worked into the end of the ridge immediately after the cast on edge getting back to ten stitches first knit into the front and back of your one stitch giving you two stitches now you work a combination of joining ridges short row and increases for a while so i will give you ridge by ridge instructions for this bit it might be helpful to use a row counter for this stage remember apart from ridge 1 and where you are increasing in the first stitch you can still slip the first stitch of every ridge knitwise ridge 1 k1 join k1 ridge 2 kf&b join k2 3 sts ridge 3 k2 join k2 ridge 4 kf&b k1 join k3 4 sts ridge 5 k2 w&t k2 ridge 6 kf&b k2 join k4 5 sts ridge 7 k4 join k4 ridge 8 kf&b k3 join
